version_description: Minor fixes and improvements

The Tesla app has been completely redesigned to streamline access to important information and controls.  

- Access frequently used controls with one tap on the home screen
- Monitor your vehicle at a glance with a Today widget
This release contains minor fixes and improvements.
Now you can monitor your home energy with Powerwall
This release contains minor improvements and fixes, including a few bug fixes related to the Location screen
This release contains minor fixes and improvements.
Now you can set a percentage of Powerwall’s capacity for backup power. This release also contains minor fixes and improvements.
This release contains minor fixes and improvements.
Supports Model 3
This release contains minor fixes and improvements.

The 30-minute time limit on preconditioning has been removed so your car will be ready when you arrive – even if it takes you a little longer than you expected.  Preconditioning will continue running until you start driving, or your battery reaches 20%. N

When temperatures are near freezing, preconditioning will also heat your battery for better driving and charging performance. We recommend you plug in to reduce range loss, and start pre-conditioning about an hour before you plan to leave since it can tak

Tesla solar customers without Powerwall can now monitor solar production and home energy use from the mobile app.

In addition to today, yesterday, weekly, and monthly energy graphs, you can also select a yearly view. This feature is available for s

Preconditioning will also turn on your seat heaters and defrosters automatically in cold weather for your comfort and convenience. Cold weather upgrades, such as the heated steering wheel and wiper blades, will also be activated. When you start your next

This release contains minor fixes and improvements.
Powerwall Time-Based Control is now available in select regions; use when energy costs vary through the day.

Limit vehicle speed and acceleration with Speed Limit Mode. Maximum vehicle speed can be set between 50-90 mph (80-145 km/h).

NOTE: Requires vehicle software version 2018.24 or above.
This release contains minor fixes and improvements.

- Powerwall customers participating in Grid Services programs now know when their systems are benefiting the grid and can track Grid Services energy and power usage.
- Storm Watch: for Powerwall customers with backup and in selected regions, Tesla will
This release contains minor fixes and improvements.
The Inbox organizes all of your messages in one place, which you can access from the Settings menu.

- Start navigation in your car using the share feature in your favorite phone apps. Enable sharing by tapping the More button in the sharing menu.
- Allow passengers to quickly control media
- Start and cancel software updates on your car

You can now view nearby charging options in the Charging screen. Tap a location to start vehicle navigation. Note: Requires car software version 2018.48 or above.

The app now supports iPhone XR and iPhone XS Max.

When you precondition your vehicle, you can now turn on, off, or adjust any of your seat heaters. If it's available in your car, you'll also be able to turn on your steering wheel heater. Note: Requires vehicle software version 2018.48.12 or later.
